CD Projekt open world designer Jakub Tomczak doesn't, as far as I know, have an answer to the issue of production bloat, but he does have a disarmingly obvious solution to the 'checklist problem', based on his time creating missions for Cyberpunk 2077 and its Phantom Liberty expansion: get better at hiding the checklist. Weave it into the landscape and setting more artfully, with an elegant balance of randomisation and responsiveness to the player's behaviour which keeps everything fresh. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Show less, randomise more: a Cyberpunk 2077 designer on how to stop open worlds feeling exhausting

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
It is with quiet anticipation (and some nervousness) that I await to be stepped upon by a freaky mech in The Forever Winter. If you missed its announcement in May, The Forever Winter is a co-op extraction shooter set in a grim future where you struggle to survive amid an unending hyperindustrial war. Since that reveal developers Fun Dog Studios have mostly been sending out small "burst transmissions" - essentially footage from the hellfront - like this patriotic beheading and some panicked gunfights. But today they've made a longer video revealing an early access release date. And - oh! - it's quite soon.
Read more
articles.title: The mommy mechs of The Forever Winter are stomping into early access next month

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I won an awful board game from Nickelodeon once. I say “won”. Actually, I got disconnected phoning into a competition line after I’d gotten through, got upset loudly, my mum called them to complain, they fast tracked me to the next competition thing, I got the quiz answer wrong, and the presenter pretended he’d heard the right answer and pulled a prize out of the big prize bucket. It was a copy of The Game of Life, possibly the least exciting board game a child can win.
The game was dog water, and there’s probably a lesson in there somewhere about how cool and good it is to whine until you get free things, but we don’t have time for that. Instead, I’d like to draw your attention to Floops Big House Adventure. It’s a grungy, slimy, Aaahh!!! Real Monsters meets Ren and Stimpy Saturday morning shooter. Some of you will already hate it from the header screenshot, I imagine. Personally, the art drew me right in.
Read more
articles.title: Floops Big House Adventure is a Nickelodeon Saturday morning gross-out shooter

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Here’s one we missed from this week’s release round-up, possibly because Konami appear to have given it precisely zero promotion: the Castlevania Dominus Collection, a four-game bundle spanning PC ports of three well-regarded DS Castlevanias, plus a redesigned version of Castlevania Haunted Castle, the first Castlevania game to grace an arcade machine. It’ll set you back $25, £20 or €25, and my drive-by analysis of the trailer below is that they've done a decent job with the ports.
 Read more
articles.title: Konami's Castlevania Dominus Collection bundles up three DS hits and one arcade remaster for £20 or $25

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Darkest Dungeon 2's Kingdoms mode - a free turn-based boardgame reimagining of the hellish roguelike roadtrip RPG - will release in three modules, Red Hook have announced. The first of this fearful trio, Hunger Of The Beast Clan, is down to launch in Q4 2024, which translates to sometime during the period 1st October to 31st December.
It'll accompany a new paid Darkest Dungeon 2 DLC, Inhuman Bondage, which introduces a new region, a new hero with "...unique" mechanics and a fresh faction of seemingly excrement-themed fiends to slaughter.
 
Read more
articles.title: Darkest Dungeon 2's free strategy game Kingdoms update is coming in three parts, with the first due in 2024

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Remedy were “thrilled as Finnish people can be” to announce yesterday that they’ve secured funding for a Control sequel in a co-financing deal with Annapurna, who are also helping the Alan Wake studio bring their connected universe to “film, TV, and beyond”.
While I’m pretty jazzed to see what the coffee-addled minds that brought us Threshold Kids can conjure up under that tantalising ‘beyond’ label, I’ll skip the speculation from now. Here’s the skinny from Remedy’s communications director Thomas Puha:
Read more
articles.title: Remedy partner with Annapurna to co-finance Control 2 and explore Control and Alan Wake TV and film adaptations

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The first time I encountered Jack King-Spooner's work, it was when he sent me a copy of Sluggish Morss: Pattern Circus over hospital wifi late at night. The game was a bright spot in a bad time, which might seem peculiar given that Sluggish Morss often looks like a whale's upset stomach, but it's such a feverishly inventive creation. It blew the dust from my synapses.
The same appears true of King-Spooner's upcoming Judero, on which he is collaborating with Soul Searching developer Talha Kaya. It casts you as a "pagan seer" armed with a big stick, who is searching the mythical Scottish borderlands for evil creatures to clobber. It looks cheerier and airier than Sluggish Morss, with a more overt emphasis on mechanics such as combat, but it has the same pickled 3am energy to it. It's also now got a release date - 16th September - and a new trailer below.
 
Read more
articles.title: Rejoice fellow pagans, for stop-motion Scottish Border brawler Judero will launch in September

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The situation: Sumo Newcastle are making a dystopian on-foot multiplayer racing game called Deathsprint 66, in which you control one of eight Running Men hurtling through the spiked and bladed contours of a futuristic megacity. The complication: competing against other actual human beings isn't always pleasant or desirable, especially when hurtling through the spiked and bladed contours of a futuristic megacity. The solution: Deathsprint 66 is getting a set of PvE-focussed "Episodes" in which just one human player plus optional bots hurtle through the spiked and bladed contours of a futuristic megacity.
 Read more
articles.title: Bloody on-foot racer Deathsprint 66 is getting singleplayer PvE modes with grisly challenges

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Baldur's Gate 3 publishing director Michael Douse has reopened the topic of video game prices being very modest for what those games offer, commenting that the pricing of blockbusters like the recent Star Wars Outlaws has not kept pace with rising development costs and general economic inflation.
 Read more
articles.title: Baldur's Gate 3 publishing director says "almost all games should cost more at a base level" because they cost so much to make

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I would not be at all surprised to learn that the voice actors in stealthy Mimimi-style cone’em up Sumerian Six are Americans doing impressions of British accents. The opening radio chat between starting squad member Sid and a pal has that telltale charming tinge of overeager cockney. It also contains the words “bloody” and “arse” in quick succession, though thankfully not next to each other. The only piles are the logs Sid’s crouched behind as he prepares to sneak up to a cable car guarded by Nazis. That is the only haemorrhoids allusion I will ever make on this website. Until the next time I have to write about Andrew Wilson.
“Oil just use my trusty knoife” mutters Sid as I take down my first guard. Straight away, the animation and noise indicators evoke the same Shadow Tactics or Desperados III goodness you’re probably expecting. Fine with me - that’s exactly what I’m here for. Mimimi’s closing was a real gutpunch, and while I don’t expect anyone to match their exceptional work any time soon, it’s at least reassuring to see Warsaw studio Artificer picking up the torch.
Read more
articles.title: Sumerian Six is Shadow Tactics but you're hitting Nazis in the back of the skull with a hammer

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Unionised workers at Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 studio Raven Software have filed a complaint with the US National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) against parent companies Activision Blizzard and Microsoft, as reported by Game File (paywalled), and covered by Game Developer. The complaint, write Game Developer, is over “bad faith bargaining” and “concerted activities” - which covers "retaliation, discharge, [and] discipline."
Read more
articles.title: Call Of Duty Black Ops 6 developer union have accused Activision Blizzard and Microsoft of “bad faith bargaining”

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Step this way please, fans of pre-rendered backgrounds and pixellated blood spatters. There is something waiting for you in the window of the local internet video game store, GOG.com. Resident Evil 2, the original 1998 survival horror, is now buyable, downloadable, and yes, even playable on PC. 
Read more
articles.title: The original Resident Evil 2 from 1998 comes shambling and groaning back to PC

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Back in March, Bungie announced a leadership reshuffle on their Marathon reboot project, with former Valorant dev Joe Ziegler replacing veteran Bungie designer Christopher Barrett as director. It seems there was more to that story than concern about the progress of Marathon. According to a new Bloomberg report citing anonymous sources, Barrett was in fact fired this spring after he was accused by several female Bungie staff of inappropriate behaviour.
  
Read more
articles.title: Bungie reportedly fired Marathon reboot director Chris Barrett for "unwanted" and "inappropriate" messages to female staff

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Every now and then I reflect on the statistically determined average age of a Gamer – what is it now, 36, 37? Please let it still be under 40 – and realise with alarm that, by extrapolation, a lot of the people reading this probably have children. Augh, children! Please excuse me while I go stand on a chair, clutching a broom. I’ve never understood the craze for generating smaller versions of yourself. It’s one of those weirder subcultures you read about in the papers, but rarely observe in daily life. 


I do, however, understand the appeal of same-screen co-op games like Run From Mummies - which, being a bloodless comedy dungeon romp, seems like a fair pick for those encumbered with boisterous selfspawn. Don’t worry, the “mummies” of the title are just regular old disembowelled corpses wrapped in cloth, not those sinister, non-embalmed “mothers” you’ve been hearing about down the grocers.

 
Read more
articles.title: Run From Mummies will probably tickle Power Stone players as much as it does pyramid-robbing children

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Sometimes you forget to build a graveyard. It happens. When ten citizens dropped dead on the roads of one of my settlements in post-apocalyptic city builder Endzone 2, I had to work fast to avoid a sickness breaking out. But graveyards require a lot of space, and if you've already filled your shanty town with a sea of corrugated metal roofs, this poses a problem. Welcome to the pleasant headache of town planning in a post-nuclear world, where most of the land is brown and uninhabitable. 
Read more
articles.title: Endzone 2 early access review: rebuild humanity as a post-apocalyptic plate-spinner

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I do like a combat system that resembles an overflowing dressmaker's draw, full of bouncing rubber thimbles and coils of bunting. While it's not quite as chaotic and entangled as say, Disgaea, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is one of those games. I'd call it "baroque", but that would be out of synch with developer Sandfall Interactive's stated influences: the new RPG takes place in a molten and fragmented fantasy world based on the Belle Époque or "beautiful era" of late 19th century France. Your job as player is to stop a sorcerous Paintress from painting everybody over a certain age out of existence. We'll circle back to the plot, though. First, the excessively ornate battlin'.
 
Read more
articles.title: Noughties-style JRPG Clair Obscur wants to recapture the glories of Lost Odyssey, with a touch of Devil May Cry

articles.author: Rick Lane
articles.description:
Stormgate is a confusing proposition. It's an RTS directed by former Blizzard developers that is almost, but not quite, entirely unlike StarCraft. It's a free-to-play game, but has a business model that makes you feel like you're getting a rougher deal than if you just dropped thirty notes for it outright. It's available now in Early Access, but has already been available in a kind of gravity-defying Super Early Access for several weeks (which you had to pay to get into).


All of which has made me feel very tired, and yearn for the days when you went into a shop and bought a game in a box for a set amount of money, and the whole game was in the box and you went home and put it on your PC and played it until your mum said "Richard!" (only my mum calls me Richard) "get off that computer and go outside and get some exercise! Do you want to be dead at 35?" Well, I'm 36 now mum. Nearly 37. So who's laughing through their heart palpitations now?

 
Read more
articles.title: Stormgate early access review: this StarCraft wannabe brims with potential, but makes a poor first impression

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Update:  This evening, we received the following "communication from the Spiders studio":

Paris, 28th August 2024 – The Union of Video Game Workers (Syndicat des
Travailleurs (ses) du Jeu Vidéo) has publicly relayed allegations concerning the
working environment at Spiders. The false and even defamatory accusations made by
the STJV in no way reflect the reality of the day-to-day working life of the company's
employees and are an attack on the reputation of the studio, whose teams are fully
mobilized to produce quality games and enthusiastically ensure the Early Access
release of GreedFall 2.

Spiders' management is committed to open and constructive social dialogue. After
unsuccessful attempts over the last few days to meet with a delegation of employees,
they have proposed a meeting again by the end of the week.

Spiders' employees are the heart of the studio, and we are determined to maintain an
inclusive and stimulating working environment in which every talent can flourish and of
which we can all be proud.

The email was signed by Consulting Director Caroline Richard and Associate Director Laurence Tovi.
Original article continues below:
Read more
articles.title: Greedfall 2 developers call a strike over working conditions, lack of gender equality and parity, and “global mismanagement”

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: Soubory s uloženým písmem mohou mít řadu různých formátů, v praxi se ale setkáme se dvěma: TrueType a OpenType. V dnešním článku si povíme o vlastnostech těchto formátů, jejich možnostech a podpoře češtiny.
articles.title: Písma a jejich použití: formáty písem TrueType a OpenType

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Po popisu grafického subsystému počítačů IBM PC se na chvíli zastavme u instrukční sady mikroprocesorů Intel 8086/8088. Ta je totiž poměrně specifická a navíc i překvapivá v tom, jak dlouho některé instrukce trvají.
articles.title: Specifika instrukční sady mikroprocesorů Intel 8086/8088

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google se chystá prosadit další zkrácení platnosti certifikátů až na 90 dnů. Neznáme přesné datum, ale certifikační autority ho znají a intenzivně se na velkou změnu připravují. Jste připraveni i vy?
articles.title: Google chce omezit platnost certifikátů na 90 dnů, změna zřejmě přijde brzy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si zobrazíme informace o systému, vyzkoušíme grafické rozhraní pro správu Gitu, přehrajeme si hudební alba a uděláme si pořádek v oprávněních k souborům.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (11. 9. 2024): zjistěte detaily o svém počítači

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: V rámci třetího tématického bloku okolo počítače Commodore 64 se zastavím u dalšího kusu hardware, který se mi dostal do rukou. Opět se budu věnovat datovému úložišti, v tomto případě ale znatelně raritnějšímu.
articles.title: Třetí zastavení u počítače Commodore 64: 3,5" disketovka Commodore 1581

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dnes dokončíme popis možností grafické karty VGA. Ukážeme si, jaké operace lze provádět při čtení a při zápisu do obrazové paměti, a to včetně popisu rychlé operace blokového přenosu (BitBLT), kdy lze přenést celých 32 bitů.
articles.title: Skrytá síla karty VGA: čtecí a zápisové režimy (dokončení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Hledáte vhodný termín pro společnou událost? Nejen v tomto případě by vám mohl přijít vhod článek, který popisuje zkušenost s preferenčním hlasováním účastníků ve sdílené tabulce dokumentu Google Sheets s využitím Schulzeho metody.
articles.title: Preferenční hlasování ve sdílené tabulce Schulzeho metodou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Tato taškařice, vhodná na Apríla, je původně starý text z roku 2001 ze sekce „Zasmáli jsme se“ Linuxových novin, jsem autorem, takže jej ještě copypastuju na blog, abych na něj ex post upozornil.
articles.title: Šokující tajemství unixových systémů: hyperuživatel odhalen

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Kopřiva)
articles.description: Podíváme se na nový útok umožňující klonovat tokeny YubiKey, nové trendy v sextortion útocích, nebo zprávu o útocích ruské APT skupiny, na jejíž přípravě participovaly i české zpravodajské služby.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: klonování hardwarových tokenů YubiKey

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Projekt FreeBSD bude brzy dostane investici od německého fondu Sovereign Tech Fund (STF) ve výši 686 400 eur. Vývojáři KDE vtěsnali několik dalších funkcí do chystaného prostředí Plasma 6.2.
articles.title: FreeBSD dostane peníze od německého STF, nové funkce pro Plasma 6.2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Mozilla před časem oznámila, že se chystá rozšířit dobu podpory pro Windows 7 a uvažuje o rozšíření podpory i pro Windows 8.x. Doposud ale neuváděla konkrétní časové rámce, což se teď změnilo.
articles.title: Mozilla prodlužuje podporu Firefoxu na nepodporovaných verzích Windows do března 2025

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Aby se AlmaLinux ještě více odlišil od ostatních linuxových distribucí založených na RHEL, oznámil založení zvláštní zájmové skupiny pro certifikaci (SIG, Special Interest Group), ze které vzešel vlastní program certifikace hardwaru pro AlmaLinux.
articles.title: AlmaLinux oznamuje vlastní program certifikace hardwaru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tomáš Heřmánek)
articles.description: Po prázdninové pauze se koná webinář ze série PostgreSQL v pondělí 16. září. Bude se zaměřovat na novou verzi PostgreSQL 17, která oficiálně vychází 26. září, ale všechny nové funkce jsou již známé. Stejně jako všechny webináře této série je i tento zdarma, jen je potřeba se registrovat.
articles.title: Webinář zdarma: Co je nového v PostgreSQL 17

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Oracle vydal novou verzi 7.1 svého virtualizačního softwaru VirtualBox s vylepšeným grafickým rozhraním, podporou sdílení schránky na Waylandu, vylepšením integrace OCI a dalšími novinkami. Veřejná betaverze byla dostupná od června a nyní přišlo ostré vydání.
articles.title: VirtualBox 7.1 vylepšuje uživatelské rozhraní a přidává NAT s podporou IPv6

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Organizátoři konference LinuxDays podle výsledků hlasování sestavili program pro letošní ročník. Najdete v něm 73 přednášek a workshopů od 61 přednášejících. Konference bude rozdělena do pěti sálů s různou kapacitou. Vstup na LinuxDays je jako obvykle zdarma, stačí včas vyplnit registrační formulář.
articles.title: Konference LinuxDays 2024 má program a otevřela registraci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Blíží se 20 000. den unixového času, který nastane ve dvě hodiny v noci našeho času v pátek 4. října. Každých 5000 dní představuje přibližně 13 let, takže se takhle kulaté číslo neobjevuje příliš často.
articles.title: Unixový čas brzy dosáhne 20 000 dnů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Systém Snap balíčku s aplikacemi dostane v Ubuntu 24.10 důležitou inovaci. Uživatel bude moci nastavit přesněji, jaká oprávnění má aplikace spouštěná z daného Snapu k dispozici. Podpora přitom nevyžaduje žádnou úpravu samotných Snap balíčků.
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.10 nabídne detailnější nastavení oprávnění pro Snap aplikace

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Konsorcium Unicode vydalo novou hlavní verzi stejnojmenného standardu. Novinky zahrnují jak nové znaky, tak datové soubory, aktualizace základní specifikace a standardů. Celkem Unicode v nové verzi přináší 5 185 nových znaků, mezi které patří 3 995 egyptských hieroglyfů, plus sedm nových skriptů a sedm nových emoji, včetně harfy, lopaty, kořenové zeleniny či smajlíku s pytli od očima.
articles.title: Unicode 16.0 přidává smajlík s pytli pod očima, harfu či lopatu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze systému Tails přináší pár dílčích aktualizací a opravy dvou chyb. Šest-sedmička dostala novější Tor Browser 13.5.3 (staví na novějším Firefoxu 115.15.0 ESR opravujícím několik chyb + NoScript 11.4.35) a tomu odpovídající novější verzi pošťáka Thunderbird 115.15.0 a také aktualizaci OnionShare z verze 2.2 na verzi 2.6, která už umí zakládat anonymní chatovací místnosti.
articles.title: Vyšel Tails 6.7, už nevypíná předčasně firewall

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Proxmox je moderní virtualizační platforma, která v mnoha případech může nahradit VMware. Je open-source, zdarma a je postaven na otevřených technologiích jako KVM, LXC, CEPH a dalších. Pokud potřebujete provozovat virtualizaci, Proxmox je pro vás ideální stack a na našem workshopu Proxmox se dozvíte, jak na něj.
articles.title: Proxmox: moderní virtualizační platforma schopná nahradit VMware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Soudní dvůr Evropské unie vynesl dva rozsudky. První se týká daňového zvýhodňování společnosti Apple, které jí poskytovalo Irsko (PDF), druhý pak zneužívání dominantního postavení společnosti Google/Alphabet (PDF).
articles.title: Evropský soud: Apple byl zvýhodněn, Irsko má vymoci 13 miliard eur zpět a Google dostal pokutu 2,4 miliardy eur

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Příští verze balíku Mesa už nebude podporovat rozhraní OpenMAX. Nikdy se pořádně nepoužívalo a velice záhy jemu zamýšlenou roli převzaly jiné prvky.
articles.title: Mesa 24.3 už bez podpory rozhraní OpenMAX

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Tradiční trojice iPhonů nové generace byla představena a na trh zamíří už tento pátek. Apple zde sází nadále na vlastní ARM SoC, konkrétně A18 vyráběný 3nm procesem u TSMC.
articles.title: Apple představil iPhone 16 (Plus, Pro, Pro Max)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: V stredu 18. 9. 2024 o 10:00h sa začne nová séria webinárov nielen pre monitoring komunitu. Ukážeme si ďalšie riešenie PostgreSQL klastra pre Zabbixové prostredie. Tento webinár je určený pre tých, ktorí chcú dosiahnuť vysokú dostupnosť a škálovateľnosť Zabbixu pomocou spoľahlivého databázového riešenia.
articles.title: Webinár zdarma: PostgreSQL databázový klaster inak

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Šimerda)
articles.description: Je září a máme tu pátý obnovený pražský meetup vývojářů, kteří se zajímají o programovací jazyk Rust, a vedle toho konečně první moravský meetup. Kdo máte chuť se dozvědět víc a potkat se s aktivními lidmi z rustovské komunity, zastavte se 18. září v Olomouci nebo 26. září v Praze! Zájem o Rust v Česku roste, tak ať vám něco neuteče.
articles.title: Rust meetupy v Olomouci a Praze

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Server Phoronix dnes testoval dva 192jádrové ARM64 systémy. Jedním byl AmpereOne A192–32X (192 jader na 3,2 GHz) a druhým AWS Graviton4 (192 Neoverse V2 na 2,7 GHz).
articles.title: Nejrychlejší ARM64: AmpereOne proti AWS Graviton4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Čip v Raspberry Pi Pico RP2040 má svůj Rust už dlouhou dobu. Existuje například projekt rp-rs a také embassy-rs s asynchronním frameworkem pro embedded zařízení Embassy. Vývojář Jonathan Pallant přidal do projektu rp-rs podporu pro Raspberry Pi Pico 2 s čipem RP2350.
articles.title: Rust na Raspberry Pi Pico 2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Docker je dnes technologie, která proces vývoje, testování a provozování softwaru velmi zjednodušuje. Provozujte cokoliv a kdekoliv. Už nečekejte na nastavení svého serveru nebo na aktualizaci nějaké knihovny. Mějte prostředí jako součást vaší aplikace.
articles.title: Naučte se pracovat s Dockerem a kontejnery (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Vývojář KDE  Nate Graham na svém blogu před dvěma týdny napsal, že KDE bude jednou za rok zobrazovat žádost o finanční příspěvek. Bude to v prosinci a je jedno, jak tuto žádost uživatel zavře. Objeví se zase až za rok.
articles.title: KDE/Plasma bude jednou za rok zobrazovat žádost o finanční příspěvek

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Notebook Slimbook Plasma VI byl představen na konferenci KDE Akademy a už je podrobně popsán na webu kde.slimbook.es. Je vybaven procesorem AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS s integrovanou grafikou Radeon 780M, displejem s rozlišením 2560×1600, hliníkovým šasi a sloty na DDR5–5600 s podporou až 96 GB RAM.
articles.title: KDE Slimbook VI je poháněn procesorem AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Alejandro Colomar, který poslední čtyři roky spravoval linuxové manuálové stránky, oznámil, že bude muset tuto práci ukončit. Tuto užitečnou činnost totiž dělal ve svém volném čase a žádná firma jeho práci nesponzorovala. V současné době již nemohu tuto práci ekonomicky udržet. Dočasně a na dobu neurčitou tedy přestanu na tomto projektu pracovat, vysvětluje ve svém mailu.
articles.title: Údržba linuxových manuálových stránek byla pozastavena

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tým vývojářů okolo webového serveru Nginx oznámil, že oficiální vývoj otevřeného kódu projektu Nginx se přesunul z Mercurialu na GitHub. Projekt tedy bude nyní přijímat příspěvky ve formě pull requestů.
articles.title: Nginx přesunul svůj vývoj na GitHub

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Minulý týden jsme tu měli projekt internetového rádia Yoradio s ESP32. Poté jsem byl upozorněn na projekt AM/FM rádia, také založeném na ESP32 a čipu TEF6686/TEF6687. Projekt založila skupina kolem FMDX.org. Dokáže přijímat FM OIRT a CCIR 65–108 MHz a také AM dlouhé, střední a krátké vlny 144 kHz – 27 MHz.
articles.title: Open source AM/FM rádio s ESP32

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description:
Server Phoronix testoval server s procesorem AmpereOne A192–32X 
(192 Arm64 jader na 3,2 GHz) na jádře 6.11 s výchozí stránkou 4 kB a 64 kB. Jako téměř všechny Arm64 procesory je výchozí stránka konfigurovatelná a může být 4, 16, nebo 64 kB. Přitom x86 má pouze 4 kB. Větší stránka znamená větší výkon, ale také o trochu větší spotřebu paměti. Google u Androidu chystá přechod z 4 kB na 16 kB a slibuje průměrně o 5–10 % lepší výkon a asi o 9 % větší spotřebu paměti.
articles.title: Test výkonu AmpereOne se stránkou 64 kB

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Výzkumníci z Virtuals Protocol vytvořili AI MarioVGG (Virtual Game Generation), která dokáže vytvořit video hru jen podle videa, v tomto případě Super Mario Bros.  Dataset s obrázky ze hry je dostupný na GitHubu. Obsahuje přes 700 tisíc obrázků z 280 úrovní hry. Přitom se rozlišují pouze příkazy „běž doprava“ a „běž doprava a skoč“.
articles.title: AI vytvořilo hru Super Mario jen podle videa

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled srpnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za srpen 2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Patří datová centra do vesmíru? Acer představuje nové notebooky Swift Copilot+ s procesory Intel Core Ultra (Series 2). Kam míří automatizace sítí. Školy a univerzity stále více doplácejí na zanedbávání zranitelností. Kvantové počítače spolupracují s magnony.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Kvantové počítače spolupracují s magnony

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 36/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Black Hole Moon: Máme tu další nápad, jak by mimozemské civilizace mohly čerpat energii z černých děr. Odchylky v interakcích částic mají ukazovat na existenci nových bosonů. Předpovídají nový detekovatelný zdroj gravitačních vln z kolabujících hvězd.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Informatici z Matfyzu získali US patent na vícezdrojový překlad

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ness Czech spouští nový inovační datový hub pro střední a východní Evropu. Fortinet rozšiřuje bezpečnostní platformu pro ochranu kyberneticko-fyzikálních systémů. Umělá inteligence předvídá zločin a odhalí i ukrytou zbraň. Budoucnost podnikové umělé inteligence není o větším množství dat. Red Hat na podporu svých implementačních partnerů rozšířil partnerský program.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Budoucnost podnikové umělé inteligence není o větším množství dat

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nový objev ve světě polovodičů: Vědci potvrdili existenci další modifikace uhlíku. Black Hole Moon: Máme tu další nápad, jak by mimozemské civilizace mohly čerpat energii z černých děr. Vodu v hlubinách Marsu nepřeceňovat.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Technosignatury se možná dají snadno přehlédnout

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Slevy v akci Back to School pokračují. Jedna ze stránek, která poskytuje nejlepší nabídku a je také spolehlivá, je Goodoffer24.com. Zde jsou ceny které se vymykají, zvláště pro operační systém Microsoft, a to jak pro současnou verzi, tak předchozí, a také jak pro verze Pro či Home. A dále také, s exkluzivním kódem, můžete získat další 30% slevu, abyste se mohli těšit z doživotních licencí. Nebo jinak, platíte jen jednou a můžete zapomenout na problémy.
articles.title: Slevy na Goodoffer24 Back to School až 91 %: Windows 11 jen za €20, Office za €24!

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 35/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Acronis představuje novou verzi Acronis True Image na českém trhu. Prodej podnikového softwaru vzrostl v roce 2023 o 12 %. Vědci vyvinuli metodu detekce jednoatomových defektů v polovodičích. Každá pátá firma zasažena útoky na dodavatelský řetězec hardwaru. České firmy platí po útoků ransomwarem výkupné i 6 milionů Kč.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Prodej podnikového softwaru vzrostl v roce 2023 o 12 %

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Navrhují hledat temnou hmotu v neutronových hvězdách. Nová analýza dat z Webbova dalekohledu ukazuje, že s Hubbleovou konstantou nemusí být problém.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Nitridy uhlíku mohou konkurovat diamantu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 34/2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Blíží se vydání FreeCADu 1.0. Vydána byla první RC verze tohoto svobodného multiplatformního parametrického 3D CADu. Přehled novinek i s náhledy v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: FreeCAD 1.0 RC1

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Bylo vydáno Eclipse IDE 2024-09 aneb Eclipse 4.33. Představení novinek tohoto integrovaného vývojového prostředí také na YouTube.
articles.title: Eclipse IDE 2024-09 aneb Eclipse 4.33

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána (Mastodon, 𝕏) nová verze 2024.3 linuxové distribuce navržené pro digitální forenzní analýzu a penetrační testování Kali Linux (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek se seznamem nových nástrojů v oficiálním oznámení.
articles.title: Kali Linux 2024.3

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Ve FreeBSD byla nalezena a opravena kritická bezpečnostní chyba CVE-2024-43102 s CVSS 10.
articles.title: Kritická bezpečnostní chyba CVE-2024-43102 s CVSS 10 ve FreeBSD

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána první major verze 1.0 oficiálního firmwaru pro zařízení Flipper Zero (Wikipedie). Po třech letech vývoje. Přehled novinek i s náhledy a videi v příspěvku na blogu: podpora aplikací třetích stran, nový NFC podsystém, podpora JavaScriptu pro psaní aplikací, vylepšení spotřeby, zrychlení Bluetooth přenosu…
articles.title: Verze 1.0 oficiálního firmwaru pro Flipper Zero

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: K posouzení byly předány patche přidávající do linuxových stromů zařízení (device trees) zařízení s SoC A7 až A11 od Applu (iPhone, iPad, iPod a Apple TV).
articles.title: Zařízení s SoC A7 až A11 od Applu v linuxových stromech zařízení?

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Vývoj webového prohlížeče nad renderovacím jádrem Servo, aktuální příspěvek na blogu Serva (Wikipedie). Vedle referenčního prohlížeče servoshell vzniká prohlížeč Verso. Vyzkoušet lze noční sestavení.
articles.title: Vývoj webového prohlížeče nad renderovacím jádrem Servo

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Unicode Consortium, nezisková organizace koordinující rozvoj standardu Unicode, oznámila vydání Unicode 16.0. Přidáno bylo 5 185 nových znaků. Celkově jich je 154 998. Přibylo 7 nových Emoji.
articles.title: Unicode 16.0

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Radicle, distribuovaná alternativa k softwaru pro spolupráci jako např. GitLab, byl vydán ve verzi 1.0. Nyní obsahuje nad gitem postavený, rozšiřitelný protokol pro diskuze a nakládání s patchi, autentizaci a autorizaci, integraci Toru a uživatelské rozhraní v příkazovém řádku či jednoduché webové rozhraní pro prohlížení repozitářů. Projekt byl dříve představen a diskutován na Linux Weekly News.
articles.title: Radicle 1.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 6.7 živé linuxové distribuce Tails (The Amnesic Incognito Live System), jež klade důraz na ochranu soukromí uživatelů a anonymitu. Přehled změn v příslušném seznamu. Tor Browser byl povýšen na verzi 13.5.3. Thunderbird na verzi 115.15.0. OnionShare z verze 2.2 na verzi 2.6.
articles.title: Tails 6.7

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While Gentoo Linux recently ended their support for Itanium (IA-64) hardware, this popular source-based Linux distribution continues to support other aging platforms... Today they sent out an announcement highlighting their improved support for MIPS and Alpha based hardware...
articles.title: Gentoo Linux Touts Better MIPS & Alpha Platform Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Oracle today released version 7.1 of their VirtualBox virtualization software with an improved GUI, Wayland clipboard sharing support, OCI integration improvements, and other enhancements...
articles.title: VirtualBox 7.1 Released With Improved UI, Wayland Clipboard Sharing

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Early in the year we enjoyed seeing AMD Zen 5 "znver5" support upstreamed for the GCC 14 compiler in making it into that annual GNU Compiler Collection feature release. It was great seeing AMD Zen 5 support make it into this open-source compiler well ahead of any Zen 5 products being announced. Since then the GCC support for the new Znver5 target has continued to be improve upon meanwhile we've been waiting to see similar treatment for the LLVM/Clang compiler stack. Finally this week that AMD Zen 5 (znver5) support has been submitted for review in upstreaming it for LLVM...
articles.title: AMD Submits Initial Zen 5 Enablement For LLVM/Clang Compiler

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Motherboard vendors have begun rolling out updated BIOS versions for AMD AM5 platforms that allow a configurable TDP on the Ryzen 5 9600X and Ryzen 7 9700X processors to allow a 105 Watt cTDP compared to the base 65 Watt TDP. For those wondering about the Linux performance and power efficiency impact from running these mid-tier Zen 5 desktop processors at the higher cTDP value, here is the full set of benchmarks compared to my original review data on Linux.
articles.title: AMD Ryzen 5 9600X & Ryzen 7 9700X Linux Performance With 105 Watt cTDP

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the upcoming Ubuntu 24.10 release, Canonical is introducing permission prompting for more control over Snap access to systems to enhance security...
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.10 To Enhance Snap Permissions Handling

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With Linux 6.11 expected for release on Sunday that in turn will mark the start of the two-week merge window for Linux 6.12. The Linux 6.12 cycle will get underway and work towards its stable release in mid to late November. Ahead of the Linux 6.12 merge window here is a look at some of the material anticipated for merging during this next cycle...
articles.title: Linux 6.12 Kernel To Add New Features For Intel & AMD Systems, Many Other Changes Too

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Device Tree patches have been posted to the Linux kernel mailing list for review and possible upstreaming to the mainline Linux kernel for booting Apple iPhones, iPads, and iPods that use the A7 to A11 SoCs...
articles.title: Device Tree Patches Posted For Review To Boot Linux On Apple A7 To A11 Devices

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With Mozilla having backed away from the Servo web engine years ago and recent open-source development on Servo focused on making it suitable for embed purposes into other applications/software, it's remained to be picked up by any standalone web browser project. But taking shape over the past few months has been Verso as a ground-up build of a new Rust-based web browser making use of Servo...
articles.title: Verso Taking Shape As A Servo-Powered Web Browser

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: ClangIR is a new IR for LLVM's Clang compiler built atop MLIR. Thanks to this year's Google Summer of Code, there has been progress on being able to compile GPU kernels using ClangIR as another improvement for heterogeneous programming with this open-source compiler stack...
articles.title: LLVM Makes Progress On Using ClangIR To Compile GPU Kernels

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With this past weekend's release of Linux 6.11-rc7, the kernel changes for the week were larger than prior RCs and Torvalds was a bit hesitant on releasing v6.11 this coming Sunday due to the upcoming that takes place next week in Vienna, Austria. But after a bit of time and feedback from other kernel developers, Torvalds is now more inclined to release Linux 6.11 this coming Sunday rather than dragging it out for an extra week...
articles.title: Torvalds Inclined To Release Linux 6.11 This Coming Sunday

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The latest Rust-written OpenCL driver "Rusticl" work by Red Hat engineer Karol Herbst is support for shader variants and introducing an optimized kernel variant...
articles.title: Kernel Shader Variants Merged For Mesa's Rusticl OpenCL Driver

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: WolfSSL is an embedded SSl/TLS library designed for a range of use-cases and available as open-source under the GNU GPLv2. WolfSSL was recently packaged and added to Fedora Linux since Netatalk began building against wolfSSL and in the longer-term plans to require its use. So the Fedora packager of Netatalk went ahead with packaging up wolfSSL. But this in turn has led to issues and as of today is now being "immediately retired from Fedora."..
articles.title: wolfSSL "Immediately Retired" From Fedora Linux For Failing To Follow Packaging Rules

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As part of the ongoing AmpereOne testing at Phoronix with the 192-core AmpereOne A192-32X flagship processor, I've been working on several different Linux distribution benchmarks with this Supermicro AmpereOne server. That comparison in full should be published next week while worth highlighting on its own are some of the gains seen with the in-development CentOS Stream 10 that serves as the upstream to what will be Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10. There are some nice performance gains seen on AArch64 with CentOS Stream 10 compared to CentOS Stream 9.
articles.title: CentOS Stream 10 Showing Nice Performance Uplift In Early Benchmarks On AmpereOne

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel today as part of their "Patch Tuesday" released new CPU microcode for recent generation Core and Xeon processors. Two security updates were made along with fixing a handful of functional issues...
articles.title: Intel CPU Microcode 20240910 Fixes Two Security Issues, Various Functional Issues

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A patch merged yesterday to the GNU C Library (glibc) codebase can help the memset() function's performance by 24% as measured on an Arm Neoverse-N1 core...
articles.title: GNU C Library Tuning For AArch64 Helps Memset Performance By ~24%

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the upcoming Linux 6.12 kernel the Intel graphics driver will finally be able to report GPU fan speeds. Another long sought feature is also on the way for this open-source Linux driver: GPU package temperature reporting for Intel discrete GPUs...
articles.title: Intel Linux Graphics Driver To Finally Expose GPU Package Temperature

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: AlmaLinux to further distinguish itself from other RHEL-based Linux distributions has announced a Certification Special Interest Group (SIG) and out of that is coming a AlmaLinux Hardware Certification Program...
articles.title: AlmaLinux Announces Certification SIG, Hardware Certification Program

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While OpenJDK Java is available via the Ubuntu package archive and the go-to JVM on Ubuntu Linux, Canonical is working to package up Oracle's GraalVM as another option for enhancing the Java stack on Ubuntu...
articles.title: Canonical Working To Package GraalVM For Ubuntu Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel today released a new version of QATlib, the QuickAssist Technology library for enjoying hardware-accelerated offloading of security, authentication, and compression needs. Recent Intel Xeon CPUs with built-in QAT accelerators stand to benefit a lot from the new QATlib 24.09 release...
articles.title: Intel QATlib 24.09 Improves Performance For Multi-Threaded Apps & Multi-Socket Servers

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel engineers have been working on enabling NPEM for Linux: Native PCIe Enclosure Management as a means of standardized storage LED indicators...
articles.title: Intel Preps Native PCIe Enclosure Management "NPEM" For Standardized Storage LEDs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following Canonical's decision to enable frame pointers by default in Ubuntu 24.04 LTS and then they ended up adding a number of performance tools to ship by default with Ubuntu 24.04 LTS, for Ubuntu 24.10 a late change is adding another tool to be installed by default on the Ubuntu desktop: Sysprof...
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.10 Desktop To Ship With Sysprof Profiler Pre-Installed

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Thanks to the work of Valve Linux graphics driver developer Samuel Pitoiset, the Radeon "RADV" Vulkan driver is now the first within Mesa supporting the new Vulkan pipeline binary extension...
articles.title: RADV Merges Vulkan Pipeline Binary Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Intel Arrow Lake Linux graphics driver support appears largely wrapped up following a patch for properly handling the necessary GSC firmware requirements and building off all the existing Meteor Lake Arc Graphics driver code paths. There are a number of Arrow Lake PCI device IDs already present for the graphics while a new one is being added now to the kernel drivers...
articles.title: Another Arrow Lake Graphics Device ID Being Added To Intel's Linux Driver

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last year Canonical delivered an Intel TDX "tech preview" for Ubuntu 23.10 to experiment with using Intel Trust Domain Extensions (TDX) found on the latest Xeon server processors. With Ubuntu 24.04 LTS they began shipping a formal TDX software stack and now have rolled out an update to that software stack as a stable release update...
articles.title: Canonical Shipping Updated Intel TDX Software For Ubuntu 24.04 LTS

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Some long-rotting code in Mesa has been flushed out today... Mesa 24.3 is now 11.6k lines of code lighter after removing support for the OpenMAX (OMX) API that was implemented as a Gallium3D state tracker long ago and hasn't seen any activity in recent years and the upstream OpenMAX standards work halted more than one decade ago...
articles.title: Mesa 24.3 Removes Support For The Long-Abandoned OpenMAX API

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last month I wrote about Intel Linux engineers working on a new Efficiency Latency Control feature for their uncore driver. This ELC option allows for adjusting the behavior of the Intel uncore for efficiency versus latency characteristics. Those Intel ELC patches to the TPMI uncore driver are now queued up for merging with the upcoming Linux 6.12 cycle...
articles.title: Intel Efficiency Latency Control "ELC" Feature Slated For Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Excitement is building that the real-time kernel "PREEMPT_RT" support might finally be ready for the mainline kernel as soon as the upcoming Linux 6.12 merge window. It will be interesting to see if that long-awaited day finally comes this month but recently noted patches have now been queued into tip/tip.git's "sched/rt" branch ahead of the Linux 6.12 merge window...
articles.title: Latest "sched/rt" Commits Point To PREEMPT_RT Potentially Being Ready For Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the Supermicro ARS-211M-NR R13SPD server that's in the lab for a few weeks for reviewing the AmpereOne A192-32X and delivering the first independent benchmarks of the AmpereOne 192-core AArch64 server processor, the AmpereOne benchmarks to date have been comparing to other Intel Xeon and AMD EPYC server platforms. But if looking up to the cloud is the closest AArch64 server competition to AmpereOne there is: Amazon's Graviton4. In today's article ia showdown looking at how AmpereOne and AWS Graviton4 compete at 192 cores for ARM 64-bit server performance.
articles.title: AWS Graviton4 vs. AmpereOne 192-Core Benchmarks For Leading AArch64 Server Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Redox OS 0.9 has been released today as a big update to this from-scratch Rust-written open-source operating system...
articles.title: Redox OS 0.9 Brings COSMIC Apps, Better Performance & Improved Linux App Compatibility

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Earlier this summer KDE began soliciting ideas for what their goals should be over the next 2~3 years. This weekend at their annual Akademy KDE developer conference their next round of goals were solidified...

Developer Hungry Sky has announced that its cute cat puzzle game Nekograms will be released on October 3, 2024, for Nintendo Switch at a price of $7.49. The game tasks you with ensuring every cat is nice and comfy on its own cushion, which is harder than you think. 


Hungry Sky is a game developer based in Western Australia and is incredibly excited about releasing Nekograms, its very first game, on Nintendo Switch later this year. It's just like all those cozy games you've tried out on Steam, but somehow even more chilled out. The game is already available on mobile devices, but it's been enhanced for the handheld console to allow for even more replayability and a completely different experience in some cases. articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
The Call of Duty series spans multiple console generations, iterating through its history. Subsets like Black Ops have become just as, if not more, popular than the originals. Over twenty years later, dozens of entries exist, making the timeline understandably complex. Here's every Call of Duty game in order.


1. Call of Duty (2003)


Image via Activision


After making the incredible Medal Of Honor: Allied Assault, some devs at 2015, Inc. decided that they wanted more, and so went on to form Infinity Ward and give us the original Call Of Duty. The result was an even more faithful and grittier redo of some of WWII's most important battles. It became a critical and sales success, naturally spawning Activision's most famous franchise.


2. Call of Duty 2 (2005)


Image via Activision


The …

Will NBA 2K25 MyCareer mode get a trade request?

Disney Lorcana's sixth major set is called Azurite Sea. It brings characters from Big Hero Six and just about everybody from Rescue Rangers to the TCG in a fresh new setting: The Azurite Sea. Characters take to the seafaring setting with brilliant abilities to build a new deck around. 


The Disney Lorcana Azurite Sea set was revealed during September 2024's Lorecast livestream. It's one that's been in the works since the game's creation and brings some very exciting cards to the game. Disney Lorcana Azurite Sea set release date

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
If you’ve been hoping to take The Plucky Squire on the road, or in places where your PC can’t quite go, then you’re in luck — All Possible Futures has revealed that the game has obtained Steam Deck Verification in time for digital release on September 17. 


This is amazing news for anyone with a Steam Deck, as the in-and-out-of-the-storybook adventure can now be played both in and out of the house, and there’s nothing stopping you from taking the cutesy cartoon world wherever you’re going. 




Back in December 2023, Devolver Digital cheekily noted on Twitter they were playing on Steam Deck, so the verified status should come as no surprise to future players. However, it has been a fair while (9 months, but who’s counting?) since then, and I for one was beginning to worry that verification wouldn’t come until after the digital release. 


The Plucky Squire doesn’t appear on the Steam Deck website's list of officially verified games just yet, but just knowing that it should soon be there is more than enough to keep me happy.


If you’re a Steam Deck owner twiddling your thumbs as you wait for release, The Plucky Squire will be joining a long list of other epic games that are verified, including Fields of Mistria, No Man’s Sky, and Baldur’s Gate 3, so there’s plenty to keep you occupied while you wait.

The post The Plucky Squire gets Steam Deck Verified ahead of September 17 launch appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The Plucky Squire gets Steam Deck Verified ahead of September 17 launch

While battling your way through the PvE Operations missions in Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2, you'll eventually encounter the Heldrake boss. In the main campaign, you don't need to fight this beast. But in Operations, you've got to take it down.

World War I history enthusiasts, young adult literature readers, and anime fans have something to look forward to next year. Scott Westerfield's alternate-historical war novel Leviathan is getting an anime adaptation, and it debuts on Netflix in 2025.

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
If you've been collecting a bunch of bots at the Crash Site, you're in for a treat with their many unique interactions. Some even reward you for specific actions, including dancing, punching, and capturing photos. In this guide, we'll focus on one achievement by showing you how to unlock the Astro Bot Let's Twist Again trophy.


How to unlock Astro Bot Let's Twist Again trophy


Based on the trophy hint, you'll need to find an "iconic marsupial" at the Crash Site. This mysterious character is none other than Crash Bandicoot, who can be unlocked relatively early in the saga. Go up to Crash Bandicoot and dance with him by pressing down on the D-Pad, earning you the Let's Twist Again trophy in Astro Bot. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


If you still need to acquire the character, travel to Gorilla Nebula and enter the Az-Tech Trail. Progress through the course until you see a stack of fruit crates. Hit it to place Crash Bandicoot in your collection.


Screenshot by Destructoid


You may also need his Spinning Marsupial animation, purchasable from the Gatcha Lab for 100 coins. Now, locate Crash Bandicoot, who will be to the right of the Crash Site's desert region, and start dancing. You can commemorate the occasion, too, with a photo by pressing down on the D-Pad.


In addition to the trophy, you can punch the marsupial to uncover another distinct animation. You'll also discover plenty more unlockable trophies nearby, including going to the top of the Mothership for the At the Top of My Game achievement or dancing with 100 bots in Bot Bot Revolution. If you need some help, check out our guides on unlocking hidden trophies and the Thick as Thieves achievement.

The post How to get Let’s Twist Again trophy in Astro Bot appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to get Let’s Twist Again trophy in Astro Bot

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
I always have one eye on the classics that get added to the PlayStation Plus Catalog lineup. There are some eclectic choices that come up, and that’s what I’m always hungry for. This month, there’s a game you should try. Mr. Mosquito is peak ‘00s weirdness.


It’s a pretty cool month. Not that I’m subscribed to Extra or Premium, but if you are, there’s some cool stuff. Plucky Squire is a pretty exciting upcoming title and Night in the Woods is pretty boss (so I’ve heard). I’ll give you the full list from Sony’s blog in just a minute, but first, let’s talk about Mr. Mosquito.


Image via Sony


Actually, I did a full write-up of Mr. Mosquito. Is it a good game? Not really. However, it’s an interesting and unique game, which makes it worth playing. You take the role of a mosquito that has to harass a family until they all suffer a catastrophic mental breakdown. I can really relate to that. It’s the sort of weird concept that was more common back before publishers learned that the only way to make enough money to feed their super-yacht addictions is to put a dude with a gun on the cover.


You’ve also got Skygunner, a decent 2001 on-rails shooter from back when those were still a thing. There’s also Secret Agent Clank from the days when there was far too much Ratchet & Clank.


Now I will paste… No, wait, they formatted this in a very unpaste-able way. I’m going to have to go through this individually. Okay, well, here’s the list:


PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium | Game Catalog



The Plucky Squire | PS5


Under The Waves | PS4, PS5


Night in the Woods | PS4, PS5


Chernobylite | PS4, PS5


Wild Card Football | PS4, PS5


Space Engineers | PS4, PS5


Road 96 | PS4, PS5


Ben 10 | PS4


Far Cry 5 | PS4



PlayStation Premium | PS VR2 & Classics



Pistol Whip | PS VR2


Secret Agent Clank | PS4, PS5


Sky Gunner | PS4, PS5


Mister Mosquito | PS4, PS5

David Alaba CB 85


Ronald Araujo CB 85


Mamardashvili GK 85


Iago Aspas ST 84


Alex Remiro GK 84





As far as the ratings are concerned, Real Madrid has managed to trump their traditional rivals. The top three cards all belong to the Madrid giants: Kylian Mbappe, Jude Bellingham, and Vinicius. Out of them, Bellingham has received one of the biggest buffs—he is rated at only 86 in EA FC 24.


Goalkeeper Marc Andre Ter Stegen is Barcelona's highest-rated card this year, followed by Robert Lewandowski at 88. Based on the ratings, Real Madrid should be an excellent choice for many players in Seasons and Career Mode. Inaki Williams also experienced a big jump in his numbers following an impressive year for both the club and the country.


We will have detailed reviews for all these cards once EA FC 25 goes live in early access on September 20.

The post EA FC 25: Top 25 LaLiga players appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: EA FC 25: Top 25 LaLiga players

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Dutch anti-piracy group BREIN has submitted its recommendations for the EU's Counterfeiting and Piracy Watchlist. The group notes that its court-ordered site blocking efforts appear to be paying off but several intermediaries could be more cooperative. This includes domain registrar Namecheap, which refuses to block customers' sites without a U.S.  court order. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Namecheap Flagged for EU ‘Piracy Watchlist’ After Failing to Block Infringing Sites

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
UK broadcaster Sky has submitted its report to the European Commission providing its overview of the latest piracy threats. These submissions guide the EC as it updates its 'Counterfeit and Piracy Watch List' and this time around some rightsholders want intermediaries to receive special attention. Sky's submission dedicates more space to Cloudflare than even the most egregious pirate IPTV hosting providers, and Facebook doesn't get off lightly either.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sky Calls Out IPTV Piracy Facilitators, Including Cloudflare & Facebook

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Verizon is pushing back against a copyright infringement lawsuit filed by several major music labels, arguing that inaction in response to piracy notices doesn't equate to liability. Citing a recent Supreme Court ruling, Verizon is calling for an end to these "lucrative" piracy liability lawsuits. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Verizon Asks Court to Dismiss Music Labels’ Piracy Liability Lawsuit

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Motion Picture Association (MPA) has submitted its latest overview of piracy threats to the European Commission. The submission details many of the usual targets, including torrent sites, streaming portals, and piracy apps. The main theme, however, concerns the role of third-party intermediaries. According to the MPA, these companies should take more responsibility, whether they like it or not.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Hollywood and Netflix Report Piracy Threats to the EU, Call for ‘Intermediary’ Action

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Swedish anti-piracy group Rights Alliance has just announced the prosecution of a man allegedly behind pirate IPTV service 'Ghost Farmer TV'. The case is one of several initiated in Sweden in recent years but, for rightsholders, a few prosecutions simply isn't enough. Sweden's Justice Minister considers calls from anti-piracy groups to start going after subscribers premature. That said, the government isn't ruling it out.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate IPTV Arrests in Sweden Should Include Users, Rightsholders Tell Govt.

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Borderlands' tops the chart, followed by 'Trap'. 'Inside Out 2' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 09/09/2024

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A study published this week by researchers in Spain shows how the intent to subscribe to a streaming platform is affected when potential subscribers are presented with stimuli such as advertising-based discounts, loyalty-based discounts, and prosocial anti-piracy messages. When direct threats enter the equation, does the fear factor help or hinder the intent to subscribe?
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Threatening Anti-Piracy Messaging Fails to Stimulate Intent to Subscribe

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Sports piracy has been on the rise and pay-per-view events, in particular, are widely accessed through illegal channels. Turki Alalshikh, an advisor at the Royal Court in Saudi Arabia, made a suggestion this week to drastically reduce PPV pricing to cut piracy. American boxer Chris Algieri has an even more drastic idea: "Make it free," he says. UFC CEO Dana White, meanwhile, sees more mileage in prosecuting pirates. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Make Pay-Per-View Access to Boxing Events Free to Fight Piracy’

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
KimCartoon, a pirate site dedicated to all things cartoon, surprised users this week with a sudden "That's All Folks" before shutting itself down. With an estimated 120 million visits over the last 12 months alone, KimCartoon was a very busy site and with that kind of traffic, life can get complicated. The site's operator says the site was shut down "due to DMCA" but, after weathering many storms over the years, maybe there's a little bit more to it than that.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: That’s All Folks: KimCartoon’s 120m Visit Piracy Caper Ends in a DMCA Disaster

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Danish police have arrested a 39-year-old man who shared nude scenes of more than a hundred female actors through Reddit and porn sites. The suspect has been charged with copyright infringement. While posting small clips from movies or TV-shows typically doesn't result in criminal action, taking nude clips out of context is considered a breach of actors' and filmmakers' integrity.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Man Arrested for Sharing Copyright Infringing Nude Scenes Through Reddit

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Second Circuit Court of Appeals has dealt a blow to the Internet Archive's digital book lending program. The court upheld a lower court's decision, stating that IA's practice of scanning and lending copyrighted books without permission is not fair use. IA's lending program directly threatens the revenues of publishers and violates copyright law, the judges ruled.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Internet Archive Loses Landmark E-Book Lending Copyright Appeal Against Publishers

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Major sports rightsholders and broadcasters in Canada have selected UK-based site-blocking veterans Friend MTS to carry out all pirate IPTV blocking under a Federal Court injunction obtained during the summer. The fact that NHL, NBA, and Premier League streams will be blocked by major Canadian ISPs was widely reported. Yet, with significantly less fanfare, it appears that the UFC and MLB have also entered the blocking arena.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: UFC & MLB Join Pirate IPTV Blocking as Broadcasters Collaborate to Cut Costs

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
This weekend, popular torrent site TorrentGalaxy went 'offline' displaying an image that some interpreted as a farewell message. Today the site returned and uploads at third-party sites resumed simultaneously. This is the second time in a few weeks that the site has gone through this mysterious cycle. The main question that remains: Why?
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TorrentGalaxy is Back Online & Uploads Resume

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
After obtaining an injunction and an invasive search and seizure order at Canada's Federal Court, teams from Bell, Rogers, Disney, Paramount, Columbia, and Warner Bros. targeted the alleged operators of IPTV service SmoothStreams at their homes in Canada. The defendants were charged with contempt of court when they failed to comply with the terms of the order. Two years later, the defendants are paying a heavy price and the main case hasn't even started.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Bell, Rogers & MPA’s Pirate IPTV Lawsuit is a Slow-Motion Money Pit Nightmare

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Nhentai, a popular adult site with dozens of millions of monthly visits, has been sued for copyright infringement. The lawsuit was filed by California company PCR Distributing, which operates several hentai brands. The complaint alleges that nhentai doesn't respond to takedown notices. The site attempted to settle the dispute confidentially months ago, but that attempt failed. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Pirate’ Site nHentai Sued in U.S. Court for Copyright Infringement

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A co-founder of a group, formed to raise awareness of "damaging" religious instruction received by schoolchildren in the U.S., now has support from the Electronic Frontier Foundation. After Zachary Parrish published the LifeWise Academy's children's curriculum on the website of 'Parents Against LifeWise' he was sued for copyright infringement. In support of a motion to dismiss, EFF says that copyright law isn't a tool to silence critics and a fair use defense will prevail.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: EFF Assists Critic’s Fair Use Defense Over Kids’ Religious Program ‘Leak’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Cheat seller AimJunkies has suffered two new setbacks in its legal battle with 'Destiny 2' developer Bungie. The Seattle District Court refused to overturn a jury verdict issued in May and will not grant a new trial. Separately, the Court of Appeals affirmed a $4.3 million arbitration award, concluding that no clear errors were made and that the scale of the award is not “completely irrational”
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Court Denies Cheat Seller AimJunkies a New Trial, Affirms Bungie’s $4.3m Win

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The spectacular demise of Fmovies, Aniwave, and a dozen or more related big-brand pirate sites, has former users asking the same question: Are they really gone forever? With many resurrections and Dr. Who-like regenerations over recent years, some seem optimistic. Government records suggests that business bridges are being built from Hollywood to Vietnam, and back again. It seems unlikely that the resurrection of pirate sites would help in any way.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Fmovies & Aniwave: Will The Masters of Pirate Resurrection Rise Again?

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Popular torrent site TorrentGalaxy once again confuses users with a mysterious message. Instead of the usual list of downloads, it simply shows an image from the film Logan and the brief message "TG Forever". This is similar to a notice that appeared on the site a few weeks ago, after which it eventually resumed business as usual. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TorrentGalaxy Spooks Users with More ‘Downtime’

Support for Pixel 9 Series Devices
You can now test your apps on the Google Pixel 9 series device configurations. Android Studio and the latest Android Emulator now have device definitions for the Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro, Pixel 9 Pro XL, and the Pixel 9 Pro Fold, enabling you to validate your apps on these virtual devices to ensure they react correctly to a variety of screen sizes and device types. You should use API 35 with the Pixel 9 AVDs to ensure the best experience and access to the latest platform features.
